title: 21 Best Affordable Couches in 2024 That Look Expensive
description: All sorts of steals for under $2,000
author: Erika Owen, Audrey Lee
excerpt: We scoured the internet for the best affordable couches under $2,000, including sectionals and chaises from West Elm, Article, Wayfair, and beyond.
text: Something you realize pretty quickly when diving into the wide world of furniture shopping is that finding the best affordable couches will take time (and lots of browsing). Thankfully, there are a wealth of options in the sub-$2,000 sofa category, if your budget is only netting you…approximately half an accent chair these days.With a slew of direct-to-consumer companies offering sofas minus the middle man and big-box retailers shilling flat-pack options at a fair price point, there are a bunch of budget-friendly options at your disposal. Just remember to factor in shipping costs, along with any customization services and white-glove delivery.Combing through all of the affordable couches to find The One to tie your living room together can prove onerous, especially with so much junk out there. But don’t fret. We’ve sorted all the best budget-friendly sofas that look a lot more expensive than they actually are.Our Top PicksBest Overall: Abisko Sofa, $1,199 at ArticleMost Comfortable: Osborn Sofa, $1,499 at West ElmBest Sectional: Honbay U-Shaped Sectional Sleeper Couch With Storage Chaise, $1,400 at WayfairBest Sleeper Sofa: Nordby 87" Sofa Bed, $1,599 at ArticleBest Chaise: Jonathan Right Chaise, $1,099 at CastleryWhether your interior design taste leans tailored and midcentury modern, or cozy and maximalist, we did the digging for you to surface several budget-friendly candidates for your new couch. Without further ado, a short list of the finest picks we could find for less than $2,000.And if you’re looking for a couch at a certain price point, click below to jump to a specific section.Under $1,000 | $1,000 — $1,500 | $1,500 — $2,000The Best Affordable Couches Under $1,000Sanders Velvet SofaOval velvet seat cushions make up the base and back of this squishy Article couch that beckons you to sit and sprawl out. The thin Scandi-style legs are just long enough that you can stuff some storage bins under there where the dust bunnies live, and the polyester fabric is low-absorption, so if you get a little too wild with your red wine or coffee, there’s still time to make a dash for some paper towels before it’s fully seeped in.Engage Mid-Century Modern Upholstered LoveseatModway’s midcentury couch is one of our favorite Prime-able couches on Amazon. It has a relatively small footprint for tight spaces, and balances on solid wood legs, with a middle-of-the-road seat depth that works for petites and people of average height. It also arrives in a handy slipcover when it ships out, so your sofa stays clean and pristine en route.Aquarius 85'' Upholstered SofaAllModern’s Aquarius sofa isn’t quite as rebellious as the star sign it’s named after, with its modern lines and bountiful cushions that cater to a wide crowd. Still, it’s got the depth to suit the name, at least when it comes to seating. It’s deep enough to really sink into when you’re dialed into a show, though shorter folks might want to choose alternative options. It’s also firm-leaning to appeal to people who want a sturdier surface to sit on.Rane FutonWhen your budget is only $200 for a new sofa (no judgement), you could go straight to Craigslist, but chances are you just want something free of dust and wear. The mattress specialists over at Serta have just the thing: a very cheap futon made up of high-density foam and coiled springs that acts like a firm mattress. Blessed with a midcentury look, it’s the ideal not-so-expensive find for folding down in a spare room or den when you have guests come through.West Elm Penn SofaThe three-seater Penn Sofa from West Elm comes in a blue-gray velvet. What it lacks in customization options, it makes up for in comfort and affordability. It comes optimally cushioned with high armrests and bold, spindly metal legs.Pottery Barn Teen Cushy Lounge Sectional SetModular sofas like this L-shaped one are great if you want to move your furniture around, break things down into multiple single-seaters sprinkled around the room, or keep it all connected for cuddly movie nights. The possibilities are endless with how you can configure these three pieces, as well as the color and performance fabrics you can purchase them in (you can have the velvet couch of your dreams!).Mella SofaPerformance velvet, a lovely curved silhouette, and a little peek of rubberwood legs make this the kind of piece of furniture that becomes a focal point of any living space it’s parked in. Great for small apartments, the design looks high-end while maintaining minimal charm (thank you, velvet). It does run on the firmer side, which is something to keep in mind. But if you’re in the market for a comfortable sofa that’s perfect for reading, watching a movie, or hanging out with friends, well…you found it. The cushions are attached, and it’s recommended that any stains are spot-cleaned.Burrow Range 2-Piece SofaBurrow aims to cut out unnecessary markups while manufacturing highly customizable products with upcycled fabrics and sustainable wood. This small-space-friendly two-seater is our top choice because it’s completely customizable, from the colorways and arms to the legs (we reviewed the three-piece here).The Best Affordable Couches Between $1,000 — $1,500Leroy Loveseat (60")If there’s anything West Elm does well, it’s a velvet sofa, and Leroy is just the comfy love seat for cozying up with someone or just cozying up with the special someone that is Netflix. Leroy is available in a soft velvet like the one pictured here or a number of finishes like linen, twill and chenille (so you can customize it for whatever living area it’s about to bless).Article Abisko SofaWe love all things overstuffed (hello, cloud couch trend) because they offer supreme comfort. This option from Article arrives in two separate pieces for easy moving and assembly. It has wide, cushioned armrests which can double as a pillow in a pinch. If you’re in need of a sofa that’s neutral but still ultra-comfortable, look no further.Osborn SofaConsider this puffy pick the Cloud Couch’s cousin. Just looking at West Elm’s Osborn sofa makes us feel relaxed and ready to curl up. The exaggerated curves feel playful, though don't and it’s firm without being uninviting. Choose from a number of fabric styles and color options, from a sandy bouclé to gray performance velvet.Albany Leather SofaAlbany Park’s signature three-seater faux leather couch is a dream for anyone who loves the look and feel of real cowskin. We can't ignore all the luxurious hues of velvet upholstery available, if that's more your style though. Plus it’s the ideal size for stretching out and reclining.Jonathan Right ChaiseThis modern chaise is technically one part of Castlery’s modular sofas, but it can certainly stand alone in a room with other seating. It comes in a few neutral shades, as well. Push it up against a wall or nestle it near a side table, and expect a nice alternative to poufs and other low-lying seating.Interior Define Lennox LoveseatWe’re huge fans of Interior Define’s Gaby sectional, and the brand also offers several sofas in the under $2,000 price range. The Lennox is customizable when it comes to color, fabric, leg type, cushion type, depth, fill, and size. The Lennox has a classic shape, but the deep-toned upholstery adds a vintage element that'll stand out in your living room.Urban Outfitters Roma SofaThe curvy bottom edge alone sold us on this one (along with the gorgeous hue). It’s playful, it’s modern, and has a soothing color and design. Plus, without any arms to speak of, it's easier to fit in tighter spaces. Fill it with throw pillows and get ready for some cozy naps.Albany Park Kova Sofa 86"For anyone decorating a smaller space who still wants to provide a cozy spot to nap, this pick from Albany Park certainly fits the bill. Prepare to sink into the deep hypoallergenic foam cushions for hours on end. You can choose from different fabric options—including stain-resistant, pet-friendly, and kid-friendly—all of which come in a handful of different colors.The Best Affordable Couches Between $1,500 — $2,000Nordby 87" Sofa BedArticle’s Nordby took the top spot in our list of the finest sofa beds for its attractive price point and easily convertible frame that folds out into a full-size pullout bed. Its minimal look and chunky legs are easy to swallow when you’re on a tight budget and, though the sofa itself is decently firm, your guest can at least relish the fact that they’re not on a saggy air mattress when they’re sprawled out on it.Cleon One Arm SofaBlu Dot’s left- or right-leaning Cleon is the perfect couch for resting your elbow on your chin and pondering the plot twist of a Cristopher Nolan movie or the meaning of it all. With a wide, puffy base and gently pleated seams, it’s soft around the edges but with a hardy wood frame to rest your back against.Sabai The Essential SofaNot only does the Essential Sofa from Sabai have a fairly wallet-friendly price tag, it also has serious sustainability cred. The solid wood frame is made of FSC-certified lumber, the foam-filling is CertiPUR-certified, and the pillows are made of recycled fiber fill. Plus it leans into a classic silhouette that’ll fit any decor style, featuring square arms and one long foam cushion. It’s a green flag in our book!Crate & Barrel Pacific Armless Sofa with Wood LegsAnything with cute, chunky legs is going to add some personality to your space—and make it look more expensive. This armless seat is anchored by square, wooden legs and you even get to choose between a variety of color ways (we love the look of natural rubberwood). The taller back cushion offers up some serious support, whether you’re lounging or working. Plus, the armless construction means the couch will prove a little easier to fit into tighter spaces.Strato 80" Camel Velvet SofaWe’ll give you a second to take in this ‘70s-inspired beauty. Yes, it comes in right at $1,999, but it makes a statement without being so trendy you’ll want to sell it on Facebook Marketplace next year. Framed in solid wood and ensconced in camel velvet, this two-seater sofa lasts for the long haul.
html:
Something you realize pretty quickly when diving into the wide world of furniture shopping is that finding the best affordable couches will take time (and lots of browsing). Thankfully, there are a wealth of options in the sub-$2,000 sofa category, if your budget is only netting you…approximately half an accent chair these days.

With a slew of direct-to-consumer companies offering sofas minus the middle man and big-box retailers shilling flat-pack options at a fair price point, there are a bunch of budget-friendly options at your disposal. Just remember to factor in shipping costs, along with any customization services and white-glove delivery.

Combing through all of the affordable couches to find The One to tie your living room together can prove onerous, especially with so much junk out there. But don’t fret. We’ve sorted all the best budget-friendly sofas that look a lot more expensive than they actually are.

Our Top Picks

  • Best Overall: Abisko Sofa, $1,199 at Article
  • Most Comfortable: Osborn Sofa, $1,499 at West Elm
  • Best Sectional: Honbay U-Shaped Sectional Sleeper Couch With Storage Chaise, $1,400 at Wayfair
  • Best Sleeper Sofa: Nordby 87" Sofa Bed, $1,599 at Article
  • Best Chaise: Jonathan Right Chaise, $1,099 at Castlery

Whether your interior design taste leans tailored and midcentury modern, or cozy and maximalist, we did the digging for you to surface several budget-friendly candidates for your new couch. Without further ado, a short list of the finest picks we could find for less than $2,000.

And if you’re looking for a couch at a certain price point, click below to jump to a specific section.

Under $1,000 | $1,000 — $1,500 | $1,500 — $2,000

The Best Affordable Couches Under $1,000

Sanders Velvet Sofa

Oval velvet seat cushions make up the base and back of this squishy Article couch that beckons you to sit and sprawl out. The thin Scandi-style legs are just long enough that you can stuff some storage bins under there where the dust bunnies live, and the polyester fabric is low-absorption, so if you get a little too wild with your red wine or coffee, there’s still time to make a dash for some paper towels before it’s fully seeped in.

Engage Mid-Century Modern Upholstered Loveseat

Modway’s midcentury couch is one of our favorite Prime-able couches on Amazon. It has a relatively small footprint for tight spaces, and balances on solid wood legs, with a middle-of-the-road seat depth that works for petites and people of average height. It also arrives in a handy slipcover when it ships out, so your sofa stays clean and pristine en route.

Aquarius 85'' Upholstered Sofa

AllModern’s Aquarius sofa isn’t quite as rebellious as the star sign it’s named after, with its modern lines and bountiful cushions that cater to a wide crowd. Still, it’s got the depth to suit the name, at least when it comes to seating. It’s deep enough to really sink into when you’re dialed into a show, though shorter folks might want to choose alternative options. It’s also firm-leaning to appeal to people who want a sturdier surface to sit on.

Rane Futon

When your budget is only $200 for a new sofa (no judgement), you could go straight to Craigslist, but chances are you just want something free of dust and wear. The mattress specialists over at Serta have just the thing: a very cheap futon made up of high-density foam and coiled springs that acts like a firm mattress. Blessed with a midcentury look, it’s the ideal not-so-expensive find for folding down in a spare room or den when you have guests come through.

West Elm Penn Sofa

The three-seater Penn Sofa from West Elm comes in a blue-gray velvet. What it lacks in customization options, it makes up for in comfort and affordability. It comes optimally cushioned with high armrests and bold, spindly metal legs.

Pottery Barn Teen Cushy Lounge Sectional Set

Modular sofas like this L-shaped one are great if you want to move your furniture around, break things down into multiple single-seaters sprinkled around the room, or keep it all connected for cuddly movie nights. The possibilities are endless with how you can configure these three pieces, as well as the color and performance fabrics you can purchase them in (you can have the velvet couch of your dreams!).

Mella Sofa

Performance velvet, a lovely curved silhouette, and a little peek of rubberwood legs make this the kind of piece of furniture that becomes a focal point of any living space it’s parked in. Great for small apartments, the design looks high-end while maintaining minimal charm (thank you, velvet). It does run on the firmer side, which is something to keep in mind. But if you’re in the market for a comfortable sofa that’s perfect for reading, watching a movie, or hanging out with friends, well…you found it. The cushions are attached, and it’s recommended that any stains are spot-cleaned.

Burrow Range 2-Piece Sofa

Burrow aims to cut out unnecessary markups while manufacturing highly customizable products with upcycled fabrics and sustainable wood. This small-space-friendly two-seater is our top choice because it’s completely customizable, from the colorways and arms to the legs (we reviewed the three-piece here).

The Best Affordable Couches Between $1,000 — $1,500

Leroy Loveseat (60")

If there’s anything West Elm does well, it’s a velvet sofa, and Leroy is just the comfy love seat for cozying up with someone or just cozying up with the special someone that is Netflix. Leroy is available in a soft velvet like the one pictured here or a number of finishes like linen, twill and chenille (so you can customize it for whatever living area it’s about to bless).

Article Abisko Sofa

We love all things overstuffed (hello, cloud couch trend) because they offer supreme comfort. This option from Article arrives in two separate pieces for easy moving and assembly. It has wide, cushioned armrests which can double as a pillow in a pinch. If you’re in need of a sofa that’s neutral but still ultra-comfortable, look no further.

Osborn Sofa

Consider this puffy pick the Cloud Couch’s cousin. Just looking at West Elm’s Osborn sofa makes us feel relaxed and ready to curl up. The exaggerated curves feel playful, though don't and it’s firm without being uninviting. Choose from a number of fabric styles and color options, from a sandy bouclé to gray performance velvet.

Albany Leather Sofa

Albany Park’s signature three-seater faux leather couch is a dream for anyone who loves the look and feel of real cowskin. We can't ignore all the luxurious hues of velvet upholstery available, if that's more your style though. Plus it’s the ideal size for stretching out and reclining.

Jonathan Right Chaise

This modern chaise is technically one part of Castlery’s modular sofas, but it can certainly stand alone in a room with other seating. It comes in a few neutral shades, as well. Push it up against a wall or nestle it near a side table, and expect a nice alternative to poufs and other low-lying seating.

Interior Define Lennox Loveseat

We’re huge fans of Interior Define’s Gaby sectional, and the brand also offers several sofas in the under $2,000 price range. The Lennox is customizable when it comes to color, fabric, leg type, cushion type, depth, fill, and size. The Lennox has a classic shape, but the deep-toned upholstery adds a vintage element that'll stand out in your living room.

Urban Outfitters Roma Sofa

The curvy bottom edge alone sold us on this one (along with the gorgeous hue). It’s playful, it’s modern, and has a soothing color and design. Plus, without any arms to speak of, it's easier to fit in tighter spaces. Fill it with throw pillows and get ready for some cozy naps.

Albany Park Kova Sofa 86"

For anyone decorating a smaller space who still wants to provide a cozy spot to nap, this pick from Albany Park certainly fits the bill. Prepare to sink into the deep hypoallergenic foam cushions for hours on end. You can choose from different fabric options—including stain-resistant, pet-friendly, and kid-friendly—all of which come in a handful of different colors.

The Best Affordable Couches Between $1,500 — $2,000

Nordby 87" Sofa Bed

Article’s Nordby took the top spot in our list of the finest sofa beds for its attractive price point and easily convertible frame that folds out into a full-size pullout bed. Its minimal look and chunky legs are easy to swallow when you’re on a tight budget and, though the sofa itself is decently firm, your guest can at least relish the fact that they’re not on a saggy air mattress when they’re sprawled out on it.

Cleon One Arm Sofa

Blu Dot’s left- or right-leaning Cleon is the perfect couch for resting your elbow on your chin and pondering the plot twist of a Cristopher Nolan movie or the meaning of it all. With a wide, puffy base and gently pleated seams, it’s soft around the edges but with a hardy wood frame to rest your back against.

Sabai The Essential Sofa

Not only does the Essential Sofa from Sabai have a fairly wallet-friendly price tag, it also has serious sustainability cred. The solid wood frame is made of FSC-certified lumber, the foam-filling is CertiPUR-certified, and the pillows are made of recycled fiber fill. Plus it leans into a classic silhouette that’ll fit any decor style, featuring square arms and one long foam cushion. It’s a green flag in our book!

Crate & Barrel Pacific Armless Sofa with Wood Legs

Anything with cute, chunky legs is going to add some personality to your space—and make it look more expensive. This armless seat is anchored by square, wooden legs and you even get to choose between a variety of color ways (we love the look of natural rubberwood). The taller back cushion offers up some serious support, whether you’re lounging or working. Plus, the armless construction means the couch will prove a little easier to fit into tighter spaces.

Strato 80" Camel Velvet Sofa

We’ll give you a second to take in this ‘70s-inspired beauty. Yes, it comes in right at $1,999, but it makes a statement without being so trendy you’ll want to sell it on Facebook Marketplace next year. Framed in solid wood and ensconced in camel velvet, this two-seater sofa lasts for the long haul.
